posts.post_content:
EDH rules update: Now legal in EDH. Basically he'll let you play a solid red deck.  
  
Other generals with mana symbols in their rules text are now likewise treated as if those symbols were part of their casting cost for the sake of deck legality.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: [Draco](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Draco) is probably your best bet, silly [Gleemax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gleemax) combos aside. Note that, unlike [Brion Stoutarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brion Stoutarm), he doesn't ![Tap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=tap&type=symbol) to [fling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=fling), so can keep chucking artifacts at your opponent if you have the mana for it. And at worst, he can always fling himself for 8.
posts.html:
Draco is probably your best bet, silly Gleemax combos aside. Note that, unlike Brion Stoutarm, he doesn't to fling, so can keep chucking artifacts at your opponent if you have the mana for it. And at worst, he can always fling himself for 8.
